text: UPDATED: JUN 10, 2017 Bottle from Alko, Helsinki. Pours hazy amber with a medium-sized white head. The aroma features citrusy and tropical fruitiness, berries and pronounced spiciness; seems high on hops and yeast. Taste is light to medium sweet and light bitter; hoppy flavours are strong with chacteristically Sorach Ace-like elements like berries prominent with floral hoppiness and a touch spiciness. Rich set of flavours, also some crispness adding bite. Strong fruitiness includes tropical fruits such as mango and peach. The palate is medium to full bodied and smooth in texture. Nice surprise: original but still very balanced.

330ml bottle from Pinta's in Moscow. As Ancient Nipponia Pilsner at 6.5% ABV. Pours slightly hazy gold with a medium-sized off-white head. Aroma is malt, lemon, slightly piney, yeast. Taste is slightly sweet, citrus, biscuit, caramel, light bitterness. Drinkable. Decent imperial pils.

Bottle @Ølfestival 2017. Pours clear dark golden with a small, creamy white film head. Aroma has dusty malts, wheat, hay, light vinious. Medium carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has sweet malts, doughy, very fat, some grainy notes, fairly vinious. Doesnt get too sweet. Interesting, but probably a bit one-sided.

On tap @satellite, Lausanne. 
Smells Sorachi Ace, coconut and caramel. The perfect smell. 
It has a light amber color with nearly no foam. 
Tastes Sorachi Ace, caramel, hop and malt. Bitter finish that does not last very long. 
Creamy, medium to heavy body, low carbonation. 
Just an insane brew.

Bottle 0,5. Pours hazy orange with small white head. Aroma is mainly dill and lemongrass, with some dust and banana. Taste follows the nose, however the lemongrass is more dominating than dill. Medium body and average carbonation.

Bottle thanks to Bob. Hazy copper with a medium sized white head. Sorachi notes of lemongrass and dill in the nose, some dust, sweet banana. The flavour is also dominated by lemongrass and dill, some starch, sugar, banana, chardonnay. Medium to full body, oily texture, medium sweet and bitter with some alcohol. Somewhat astringent and rough finish with alcohol. Odd and not too pleasant.
From Saveur Biere. In Teku glass. Playing Technobabylon. Odd tasting brew, with lots of what may be described as strange flowers in it. Saturates. May be because of excess of sorachi ace? Zesty too

550ml bottle. Pours a hazy orange-gold with lots of floaties and a large, frothy, long lasting, off-white head that leaves curtains of lace. Sweet aroma of pale malt, caramel, floral, apricot, orange, yeast and pine. Sweet, fruity flavour of orange, tangerine, grapefruit, lemon, melon, apricot, biscuit malt, yeast and pine with a dry, bitter, hoppy finish. Medium body with a thick, smooth, oily texture and soft carbonation. Interesting and original.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Rami Rami is drinking a Hitachino Nest Ancient Nipponia by Kiuchi BreweryDuzo przypraw (gozdziki, pieprz, galka?), nieco chlebowosci, chmielu nie czuje, w ustach slodkawe, przyprawowo-ziolowe posmaki.dziwne Rami Rami: Dziwne te przyprawy a po wiekszym ogrzaniu meczace. Do tego alko nieco wylazi, jednak to nie belg...Rami Rami: Aha, sorachi ace ani troszke nie czuje...Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

0,55l bottle shared by a friend. Pours clear golden with some flotsam and a medium head. Aroma is grainy malts with some fruity notes. Flavor is fruity and grainy malts with a hoppy finish. Good stuff.

0.55 bottle.   A hazy, gold color with a granulated, yeasty suspension, and a small, white head. Aroma of pale malts, light fruits, spices, flowers, nectar, and some herbs. It offers an uncanny combination of Belgian aromas with herbs, flowers, and nectar notes too boot - terrific. Taste is sweet, more fruity, flowers and herbs still play a big role with the latter contributing some bitterness. A medium body, an oily texture, and a soft carbonation. Finish is rather long and very floral. Overall the beer is great, but most importantly, I can say in all honesty that I have not yet tasted anything of this sort before. Points for originality.

66cl bottle (shared) at The Globe, Hong Kong on 27-Sep-2016. Reddish amber in colour with a small off-white head. Sweet aroma of malt, dark fruit, spices and malt. Full body and medium/soft carbonation. Taste heavy in malt and stewed fruit. Lightly hopped. Character of a Belgian ale. OK, but a bit heavy going.

Hazy amber. Spicy and bright nose. Theres a thin yeast smell. The palate is cinnamon and a little numbing like sichuan pepper. Its really quite lovely. Earlier Rating: 10/7/2016 Total Score: 3.7Hazy amber. Spicy and bright nose. Theres a thin yeast smell. The palate is cinnamon and a little numbing like sichuan pepper. Its really quite lovely.
Bottle. Golden amber, good white foam. Strange aroma: herb, dill, spices, slightly woody and malty, sweet nectar. Taste: malty, sweet, fruit, grass and wood.

Nez complexe mais équilibré : du malt, du résineux, des fruits jaunes, des pommes/poires confites. Magnifique.
Bouche encore plus resineuse mais reste ronde, fine, très maltée. Le sorachi est très présent sur la longueur. Très jolie.
Im a beginner, so I dont have a detailed comment, but I like this beer a lot.
Leicht trübes orangegold mit kleiner Schaumkrone. Malzig, süßlich, Kekse, etwas Karamell, Honig, leicht fruchtig.

Bottle, #h-J16, 24/06/16, thanks bluus. Pours slightly hazy with a small, but stylish, classy and long-lasting, white head. Aroma is some hoppiness, yeast, apricot, banana. Taste is semi-dry, banana, apricot, yeast. Fairly full. A mixture of a dry Belgian and a German wheat.
Cloudy med amber. Thin head. Phenols, paint on the nose. Quite sweet and a fairly pronounced alcohol character. Ok if you like strong quasi-Belgiany things.

Amber and medium-bodied. Rich malty aroma and flavour, with dried fruit and spicy phenols. Full sweet taste with light bitterness. The closest association would be sweet strong ales or even quadrupels. Overall, this is a great beer. It is very belgian and not as unique as their other beers.
Bottle. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. moderate malty and hoppy aroma. light bitter strange herbal flavor. Average light bitter finish. Oily palate. Messy.
Bottle in the hotel. Pours golden orange, nose is herbal, burnt, salty, lemon, grassy, taste is bitter, lemon, toffee, bubblegum, chewy, sweet.
Keskijuotava. Näistä ei kyllä hajun puolesta voi hyvää sanoa. Maku on mukava ja suutuntuma varsinkin. Voi näihin tottua.
On tap at unos in sampler. Clear golden with a thin head. This is a reasonable brew. .maybe Im missing the context.

UPDATED: MAY 21, 2017 A dark yellow with an orange notes, a head is medium and blond. Aroma is unique and interesting, strong notes of Sorachis herbs, fruitness, fruit candies, marzipan and mandarin. Taste has fruitness, mandarin, herbs with notes of Sorachi Ace, some bitterness is balancing the medium sweetness. Medium+ bodied, low carbonation. Interesting beer with a great aroma. Fruitful with herbs.
Orange and honey are the immediate elements on the tongue and the nose, medium think in the mouth. Alcohol is present!
Indeed special beer. Lot of earthiness and if asked I would say the most Japanese beer so far. Sorachi ace is amazing

55 cl, bottle conditioned. Golden orange, thin off-white head, nice level of carbonation, loads of floating sediments. Sweet and fruity aroma. Mouthfeel is crammed with sweet notes and carbonation. Flavours are mostly caramel and toffee up front, but also floral and hoppy. All in all its a bit too sweet and sugary, and I dont think I will buy it again.
Flaske . Klar mørk gylden farge. Moderat karbonert med stor hvit skumtopp. Smaker karamell, papp,brent sukker,overmoden appelsin. Minner lott om en slags fruktig barleywine. Ikke helt min smak

Aromat: ryż, alkohol estry - mirabelki, morele, brzoskwinie, trochę jakby wędzoność, suszone zioła, koper. Brak jednak cytrusów z Sorachi. 


Wygląd: barwa złota, wyraźne zmętniona, z pływającymi drobinkami. Piana biała, drobno pęcherzykowa, niezbyt obfita i umiarkowanie trwała.

Smak: umiarkowana słodycz, z wyraźną kwaskowością, wyraźne suszone owoce, nieco starego chmielu i alkoholu. Bez rewelacji.Podchodzi to nieco pod tripel, z dozą karmelu i szczypta wędzonki. Goryczka niewielka, delikatna. Krągła pełnia, umiarkowane do niskiego wysycenie i kwaskowo-estrowy finisz z wyraźną nutą alkoholową.

0,55l bottle. Piwo o ladnej barwie jaskrawo zoltej z lekka metnoscia i solidna trwala pianka. Zapach mirabelek suszonej moreli oraz zbozowy. Smak oleisty, trawa cytrynowa oraz oliwki zielone. Troche zielonej herbaty terz bylo i jakis ziol. Na koniec troche alkoholowe ale ogolnie smaczne i tresciwe zbozowe piwo.

Bottle 55 cl from Bier-Bienne. Reddish blonde with a fugacious cream head and average sparkling. Aromas of cereals, with a fruity notes and a grassy-zesty hops. The taste is soft, with a malted roundness and a floral hoppy bitterness. Notes of ripe fruits, coconut, lemon. Delicate bitterness and traces of alcohol.

0.55 l bottle from Alko Arkadia, Helsinki. Light amber colour with no head. First impression is like Japanese bitter - malty and bittering hops. With later sippings this turns into Belgian experience. 8% ABV might have something to do with that. Interesting and indeed a Japanese ale, not just an imitation of any specific European style.

Brown color with nice head.
Sweet malty, sugary aroma.
Flavor is full and round, sweet with some florar hops.

Bottle, 55cL. Home. A clear golden orange beer with a medium white head ; medium retention. Roast , caramel (+), sugar, candied and dried fruits, resin, light citrus. Medium sweet, round, light warming, light dry bitter refreshing. Medium body and texture, average carbonation, fruity toffee finish, light refreshing. Overall, ok round beer ; too much toffee and candied fruits aroma ; hard to finish.

Bottle from Hasewgawa. Shared at a tasting. Pours a slightly hazy copper-brown with a one-finger beige head. Sorachi ace all over the nose with dill and grass coming out. Also some malt present as well. As it warms some sake koji like notes come out. Taste is sweet with some grassy, dill notes as well. Medium to heavy body with average carbonation. Finish is sweet with some light grassy bitterness.

550 ml bottle. Hazy orange colour, firm off-white head. Sweetish malty aroma with fruity and yeasty notes. The flavour is malty, with bread and caramel, citrus and spicy notes. Moderately hoppy finish with a hint of alcohol. Not bad.

Piana żółta, szybko opada do kożuszka. Barwa złota, wewnątrz trunku unosi się sporo drobinek drożdżowych lub chmielowych. Aromat dość słodki, czuć pinakoladę (ananasa, kokosa), w tle rodzynki, winogrona, kwiaty oraz pilsowa słodowość. W smaku bardzo podobnie, delikatna słodycz owoców kandyzowanych, syropu klonowego, miodu miesza się z ananasem, morelą, sianem. Goryczka nieduża, trawiasto chmielowa. Wysycenie niskie do średniego, lekko szczypiące. Dość pełne w odbiorze, przyjemnie rozgrzewający alkohol po przełknięciu. 
Nie jest to sesyjne piwo. Alkohol co prawda dobrze ukryty, ale dość mocno słodową podbudowę nie kontruje ani wyraźna goryczka, ani intensywny chmielowy aromat. Sorachi Ace to bardziej delikatny, słodki chmiel, dodatkowo uwypuklający deserową stronę trunku.

It pours hazy orange, with a medium white head, and malty and hoppy aroma. Taste is intense barley malts, very close to a barley wineish IPA. Fruity with citric and apricot notes, well balanced by the hops. Medium bitterness, medium body, a good sipper!

from Bier-Bienne - pours a translucid bright bronze beer under a firm and persistent pale beige foam; aroma of wheat, yeast and apples; smooth palate, full-bodied, light oily, sweet and bitter; grassy, lemony and wheaty finish with some warming alcohol presence

Came into this not knowing what to expect. Pours pale gold with white head. Aromas are bananas, wheaty, slightly yeasty. Flavors are really quite unique, starts of with a rough, roasty grain flavor, nutty and very flavorful malts even for a beer of this light a color. The hop bitterness comes out on the finish, but is not overly strong. Also has a slight tang to it that is very pleasant. Like a saison with a very unique, interesting malt character to it. A very pleasant surprise.

Bottle. Darker golden in color, off-white head. Sweet sugar, floral and malty notes in aroma. Some christmas spices and vinous notes too. Interesting. Sweetish malty and hints of greenish herbs in taste. More on the sweeter side but smooth nonetheless. Light spicy and biscuity finish. Quite heavy one to drink.

55 cl, bottled. Pours clear orange with a decent white head. Very hard for me to get the zesty characters of Sorachi Ace (IMHO: Probably a good thing, too). Aroma: Grains, cereals. Plastic wrapper of smoked whitefish (Coregonus spp.). Taste: Sweet, cereals. Corn flakes! Some light bitterness, caramel. Mild but complex floral, wood and vanilla tones. Somewhat savory taste. Palate: Medium body, some carbonation. Slightly dry aftertaste. Interesting, more malty than hoppy, balanced feel.

Truly one of the stranger beers Ive ever had. One sip, and I could not get the comparison to those pink-iced starbucks cake pops out of my head. Aka, mishmash of sweet, oily flavours, that taste..artificial (which I assume this was not). Still, bubblegum, butterscotch (I assume the sorachi ace), and odd melange of fruits. And something grainy, somewhere. Not sure if I like it, but definitely not lacking in flavour.

From 650 ml bottle. Pours a slightly hazy orange-amber with a tight and lasting white head. Aromas of grass, white bread and dusty orange. Taste is rather different from what the nose suggests. Starts out with fresh pear and apple before a pepper and orange zest lift in the mid-palate along with some Belgian yeast characters. Sweet biscuits, spice and a little cut grass at the end. Medium bodied with a slightly sweet fruity aftertaste. A bit odd, but really interesting.

6.5%ABV. Pilsener.

Poured out of the bottle a gold blonde color, about 8ºSRM. 

Aroma is nice grapefruit and lemon zest. Clean herbaceous pine like aromas.

Mouthfeel is soapy. There are bread-like, water cracker and biscuit flavors.

Hop-balanced with plenty of citrus hop character, with grapefruit, lemon zest with that very nice bitter finish of a fresh citrus peel.

Nice but with a slightly less than pleasant after taste, a little umami.
Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty spicy weak yeasty aroma. Fruity malty spicy yeasty weak hoppy flavor. Has a fruity malty spicy yeasty finish.

Bottle, on recommendation of Josh and Toni. Pours amber with very little head, almost no lacing. This beer features a typical amber ale taste with clearly unusual hops and malt. Satisfying complexity, but also a bit odd.

Bottle 550ml. [ As Hitachino Nest Ancient Nipponia ].Clear medium orange yellow color with a average, frothy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt - caramel, sweet fruit, biscuit malt. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a average to long duration, sharp, fruity, pale malt, sweet malt, biscuit malt. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20150529]

Bottle at Copenhagen Beer Festival. but lasting fluffy white head. Hazy amber body.Mild and relatively sweet malt bread aroma and flavor with a bit of spices. Little hops bitterness, low carbonation and a short finish. A bit anonymous.

Aroma is rich malts, an earthiness and light funk. A nice spiciness and clove here. Taste is a complex full flavored maltiness with caramel, citrus, spices and earthiness. The floral notes balance well with the malts.light tanin on finish. Appearance is a lightly hazed gold with a thin pearl head that retains fairly well.
Bottle at KØ15. Caramelly aroma. Small off-white head. The flavour is caramelly and sweetish. Well-balanced.

Bottle, KØ15. Pours clear copper brown with airy off-white head. Clear aroma of malt and caramel, with fruity and hoppy notes and touches of bread. Sweetish flavour of caramel malt, with notes of fruit and barrel and vanilla, and bitter, hoppy touches. Bready and barrellike aftertaste. Warming alcohol presence. Decent.

55 cl bottle. Pours clear and golden orange with a small white head. Aroma is toasted malty and slight caramelish. Smooth toasted malty and light caramelish. Biscuity and toasted malty. Ligerig toasted malty finish.

Aroma: Pine, coriander, and a whiff of hops.
Appearance: A deep gold, with suspended sediment. White head.
Taste: Pine, wheat, a touch of hops, and on overpowering flavour that I cant quite pinpoint. Its like a fruity wheat beer, with noticeable coriander and something else.
Palate: Sweet and fruity, with a slightly bitter finish. Medium body. Medium carbonation.
Overall: Im a bit mixed on this one. It has a great aroma, and the taste is interesting. I wish I could pin down that overwhelming flavour.

Pours a clear gold with a fluffy white head that just wont go away. Very nice lacing on the glass. Spicy hops, with a slight citrus (lemon zest) note and a touch of alcohol. Flavour is of lemon candies and spicy phenols. An off sweet finish and slightly powdery mouthfeel, if that makes sense. The bitterness is quite restrained but there is a touch of astringency.
Une bière a la belle couleur orangée, au gout complexe, on sent le caramel en entrée de bouche et une belle amertume vient fleurir dans larrière bouche. On note la fermentation en baril a whisky.
Golden color with hardly any head. Malty, grainy aroma. Taste is sweet malts and a bit fruity. Standard carbonation. Ok.
i like the spicy fruity soapy hops in here. makes it stand out a little. never had the top fermenting version to compare, but this was solid, if a little overpriced.
Bottle. Clear golden colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of hops, malt, caramel, pine and citrus.
On tap at haymarket. Somewhat astringent and boozy. Juniper berry. Orange not getting hops.
Bue en bouteille de 66cl. Bel équilibre général. Peu de CO2 pour cette biere assez neutre en gout. On distingue la céréale. Dans la moyenne.
Bue en bouteille de 66cl, couleur blonde, belle mousse effervescence moyenne, grosse attaque sur la noux de coco et continuité forte sur le blé dur fraichement moulu, bien équilibré.
Small glass at Tadgs. Clear golden yellow with off-white head. Aromas of floral, apple, citrus. Tastes of floral, apples, herbs, light spice and wood. Medium body with a dry finish.

Bottle. Golden colour with an off-white head. Aroma is fruit, malt, caramel, pine. flavour is fruit, malt, hop, herbs, pine, ginger, floral, alcohol, caramel. Something different in this beer, but i cant say what it is .

Aroma: heavy caramel malts, ripe fruits. Appearance: cloudy gold, small creamy head. Taste: medium sweet. Palate: sweets intensify, caramel, ripe fruits, soft carbonation. Overall: very nice, exceptionally intense flavours for this style! Bottle at Yardbird, Hong Kong.

Bottle.

Head is initially average sized, frothy, white, mostly diminishing.
Body is dark yellow.

Aroma is moderately malty (sugar cookie, toasted grain), moderately hoppy (flowers, herbs, lemon), lightly yeasty (basement), with notes of unripe banana and alcohol.

Flavor is moderately to heavily sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly acidic, moderately bitter.

Medium body, syrupy texture, lively carbonation, lightly alcoholic.

Surprisingly syrupy-sugary-sweet. Nose is pleasant I guess, but a little weird and not very pils-like. Ample finishing bitterness, but the sugary sweetness never goes away. A disappointment from a usually cool brewery.

500 ml bottle. Bottle says ale. Abv 8%. Cloudy golden body, white head. Aroma has some sweet buttery toast, lychee or melon like mellow fruits, some alcohol. Flavour has very mellow fruits and sweet malts. Some bitterness and some alcohol. The maltiness is quite toasty. Very soft palate. Balanced but this is just not that good.

0,55L bottle. Pours amber with off-white head. Aroma is fruits, citrus, coconuts, some caramel. Flavor is sweet, malt, caramel, some coconuts. Finish is some fruity bitterness and notes of alcohol. Overall: good brew.

Shared by martjoobolut, thanks! Hazy amber beer, white head. Nose is grains, malts, sour notes, sorachi ace. Flavor is malt, slight sweetness, hops, rhubarb, hoppy finish. Lingering malt and hops. Sorachi ace permeates the whole beer and Im not a sorachi type of guy.
Bottled at SBWF.  Clear golden, small head. Concentrated aroma of buckwheat, pear and grass. Mid sweet with light-medium body and dense mouthfeel. Grass, pear and hay. Long bitter finish.

550ml bottle. Beer Central, Sheffield. Clear gold. Thin, dense, creamy, lasting, white head. Thick, sweet, grainy malt. Lemon. Lemongrass. A little funkiness. Taste is malty sweet. The Sorachi is fully present. Light bitterness. Palate is rich, and full. Lots of soft carbonation. Light oiliness. Finishes soft bitter. Dry close. Lots going on. Very tasty.

Herbal hops, biscuity, English, very original actually. Medium (and therefore more than expected) bitter, herbal spicy but not Belgian, more from the malt combo is my expectation. Drinks very well, even with this different taste profile. Bit tea like even, with tanines. Nice to try. (On tap at La Fine Mouse)

Bottle. Clear golden body with a small white head. Sweet honey aroma with weak fruity hops. Taste is grainy, light metallic with vanilla notes, again very subtle hopped, light bitterness, short malty and sweet finish. Quite boring and disappointing from start to finish.

0.5l bottle. Looks good this with a big white lasting and slightly lacing head over a mildly cloudy and golden looking body. Smells like a mixed of a herb spiced and a wit. Lots of wheat sweetness and coriander but also some peppery lemongrass and metal. Not horrible at all, but a bit confusing perhaps. I like it. What kind of beverage is this really? Doesnt taste bad at all. A bit fruity and pilsner-melon in the taste. Traces of alcohol and lots of pale malts. Quite pleasant to drink really relly. Ends in a soft grassy hoppy finish, some sweetness also here. Yeah, I like this even if I have no idea what Im drinking. 12.04.2014
500ml bottle. Slightly hazy amber color. No head. Sweet, yeasty, sour aroma. Sourish, fruity, sweet taste. Sourish caramelly yeast in aftertaste. Thats just bad.

Tap at GJBF Osaka 2014. Sorachi Ace very apparent in nose; seems slick and sweet. A rounded malt sweetness in initial. The Sorachi gives it a strong hop tea note. Hopping runs right down the middle of the tongue. Deep, solid, and fruity. Quite good.
Bottle. Hazy, orange, minimal head, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, soft carbonation, & bitter finish.

Flaske 550ml fra Vinmonopolet, Tromsø Sentrum. Gyldenbrun. Høyt luftig skum som daler sakte. Kniplingslacing. God aroma av pepper & ingefær. Smaken har det samme sammensatte krydderpreget. 0 kullsyre. Bra - men blir litt endimensjonal. Tungdrikkelig etter hvert.

Bottle:
Pours slightly hazed gold with a tall, off-white head.
Aroma of sweet fruit, yeast.
Flavour is pils, banana, grass...a bit of peppery spice...
Very smooth, grassy bittering.
Very good.

550ml bottle, pours light golden brown wth lively carbonation and a small white head. Aroma is distinct with belgian style yeast, spice, dill & coriander, thick caramel malt and hoppy character from the Sorachi Ace. Palate is rich and full for a lager. This is quite complex and unusual, and pleasant. Unusual but not amazing.

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy golden body with a medium creamy white head. Nose is caramel, walnuts, pale malts and hints of red fruits and straw. Taste is nutty caramel tones, walnuts in particular, hints of maize, red berries and hints of syrup. Medium body and carbonation. Pleasant stuff.

Color ámbar pálido limpio y espuma blanca ligera aunque duradera. Aromas círtricos y florales, ligero toque de fruta verde. Cuerpo medio, algo maltoso, el sabor es una mezcla cítrica y afrutada, nuevamente, de fruta aún no madura. En este sentido, recuerda algo a una saison Se nota bastante el alcohol. Muy rica.

Bottle at home. Has a slightly cloudy dark straw colour with a medium, creamy, off-white head. Aroma of citrus, Belgian yeast, spices and banana. The flavour is similar but with tones of hay, sweet malt, cloudberries and hops. Slick mouth feel, and has a light bitterness. An interesting, spicy and fresh pale lager. A little odd taste though.

Bottle. A hazy golden beer with a dense finger thick off-white head leaving curtains. Rather meaty aroma, with banana, cloves, caramel, some alcohol and a piney touch. Full body and a pleasant carbonation level. Sort of warming, which surprises me considering the alcohol level. Meaty flavor too, with the same banana, cloves, caramel and piney cones found in the aroma. Lasting finish. Well, its not bad in any way, but its too meaty for me. 140430

On bottle from Vinmonopolet Stovner. Golden slightly hazy color, ok foam. Aromas of malt, light hops, Nice yeast influence . Medium body & complexity . Some sweetness- good balance. Enjoyable & interesting

55cl bottle with BB 03.14, 6.5%. Clear golden withmedium off-white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hop, grainy and grass. Flavour is malt, fruit, hop, grainy, little grass, medium sweet and medium bitter.
Shared bottle at local tasting. Pours cloudy golden with a small white head. Aroma is strange with som some spicy and flowery hops. Taste is light spicy malts, nothing I would by again
Slightly cloudy gloden. Banana and herbs in aroma and taste. Also coriander in taste. Fine aftertaste. Complex and interesting, while still easily drinkable.

Flaske fra polet, på hytta til Sigmund april-14: spennende aroma med litt dill. Humlene som er brukt er Sorachi Ace og Kaneko Golden. God kryddersmak og passe tørr ettersmak som gjør det lett å helle innpå. Litt uvanlig, men både god og interessant.

Shared 550 ml bottle from Vinmonopolet, ABV is 6.5%. The bottle is full of floaties, but not visible in the glass. Golden colour, the aroma is a little weird, but hard to describe. Hints of sea water and also some dill (Sorachi Ace). The flavour has also hints of dill and laurel leaves, but lacks the fresh lemongrass notes.

12oz bottle into a pint glass.

Pours a clear dark gold but just a tiny bit of lacing and not really any head at all.

The Sorachi Ace hops are quite powerful in the aroma and there is also a slight earthy/oaky character. Im assuming this is from the hops as well. Pretty intersting.

The flavor has a lot more complexity than I was expecting. That same dank/citrus hop note along with a stronger note of oak and vanilla; almost like this was wood aged. Not clean at all like a pilsner but more like an aged ale. Moderate bitterness and a pretty clean finish.

Overall, this is a very intersting beer. The wood/vanilla notes are unique and I love Sorachi Ace hops. A different, but well put together beer.

Poured from a 550 ml bottle. Its an orange colored clear brew with a small white head and no real lacing. Aroma is strangely smokey and tropical fruits. Taste is quite sweet, too sweet for my taste, but with nice tropical fruits and and interesting complexity. Sticky mouthfeel. Good carbonation. Sweet, slightly hoppy finish. Less interesting toward the bottom of the glass, and rather tired of it before the glass is empty. Enjoyed as probably my last beer in Narita, Japan.

55 cl bottle from Vinmonopolet Ski. Pours amber with a medium offwhite head. Aroma is fresh, with herbal and some tropical fruits.Flavour is quite sweet, but it is nicely balanced with a good good malt base and a good amount of funky hops. Fruity taste and a long clean finish.

Medium white head. Hazy yellow body with visible floaties. Earthy
caviar (??!?) aroma with salty eggy notes. Dry earthy caviar taste
with papery fruity notes. Mid-bodied. Mild, soft mouthfeel. Dry
earthy plasticky spicy aftertaste with herbal fruity notes. Deeply
odd, but not actively unpleasant. Dont think Ill ever have this one
again. (0.55l bottle, wine monopoly web order.)
Lys oransje med lavt skum. Aroma av malt og sitrus. Smaken er kraftig sitrus, gjær og malt. Noe humle. Mildt bitter og litt tørr. Medium konsistens.
Bottle from Alesbymail. Clear golden with a white head. Aroma is dusty, malty, fruity and old hops. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 240314

Tasting @ Salon del Gourmet. Golden colour with a white head with short duration. Aroma has notes of sweet bread, good maltiness, and citrus notes. Flavor is slightly sweet with a good proportion of malts, jinger hints witha good presence of alcohol and bready notes. The final is sweet with a good duration.

Draft to a plastic cup @ Nippon Craft Beer Festival 2014. Pours quite clear, amber with a bit of foam. Aroma is nice, herbal. Sorachi? Tropical but not sweet fruits. Taste - it is crazy! Nicely sweet and has some curious fruits. From the tropics, I am sure. Malt base is strong but it has some powerful hop aromas on top, mellowed by a lagering process. Feels quite sweet and enjoyable. A big pils - wonderful!

Bottle. Another good one from this brewery-they really have opened up my eyes to Japanese beer.Orange appearance and a small head. A combination of unusual flavours including maltiness make this a very interesting one. Aftertaste is fruity making for a complex and interesting beer.

Bottled @SBWF 2013
Clear copper-amber color, steady white head. Woody, earthy hoppyness in the nose. Medium-bodied. Woody hoppyness in the flavor. Dry although has some fruityness.
8/12/2010. From bottle. Pours golden yellow with a white head. Malty aromas with hay, bread, grass, yeast and light fruit. Good bitterness from the hops. Very refreshing.

Bottle dark golden body with white not very long lasting head. Aroma is malt bread some coconut? Taste is coconut and malt aftertaste is slightly bitter some malt interresting brew. As someone has written before this would be ideal for a food pairing .

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Golden colour, small white head. Aroma is fruity, floral, caramelly and a bunch of citrus to it as well. Flavour is fruity, mild rice as well as some strange sweetness. Pleasantly balanced, but would probably suit a food table better than being drunk on its own.
65cl bottle from Redmonds. Clear amber pour, thin white head. Malt nose. Uncomplex. Sweet malt flavour lots of butterscotch. Light body. Soft carbonation. No hop character, maybe the bottle is old.

550ml bottle (Ales By Mail) - shared by vastactiv - thanks!
Golden, slightly hazy, persistent head. Spicy rice pudding aroma. Total sorachi ace taste. Nice full palalte, smooth. Soapy. Too soapy for me. But I did like how it feels, even if I really dislike the coconut.
Bottle 0.55l via alesbymail. BBE 03.14. Colour is clear golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Grain, rice, fruits, hints of citrus, spices, some hops and malts.

(Bottle, 0.55 l, courtesy of VastActiv, 20130914) The beer poured golden and clear. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had fruitiness, ginger, hint of coconut and sweetness. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were fruitiness, coconut, herbalness, sweetness, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste had coconut, fruitiness, sweetness and bitterness. The beer may have been good but the horrible sorachi ace...

Total Wine, Fairfax 12oz ($5): Pours a light orange with a white head. Aroma is grain, yeast, a hint of citrus, and some bready like stuff. Taste is nice. It is kind of flowery or perfumy. Subtle. Mellow, subdued hops. Nice mild aftertaste. Very well-balanced. Tiny bit of sweetness. Refreshing. I think the taste improves on the aroma.

UPDATED: OCT 28, 2014 Bottle dated March 2013. Lightly hazed gold with a short white head. Lightly estery nose, some rice hulls and grain husks and saccharine and some vegetable hop aroma like kale and maybe some turnip.Fruity in the nose too, but more like dried pineapple and lychee pieces. Malt is a bit rough. Smells like wallpaper glue after it opens.

Bottle dated 2014 May.  Intense spiced bubble gum, perfume, paraffin wax / glue, cedar shaving / pet urine and pineapple... and yep, the turnip note is still there a year later. Medium-full body, acidic and bitter, certainly bold but unnecessarily messy.   When the oaked chardonnay note takes hold it has no chance with me.  Ugh.
550 ml. bottle. Pours a somewhat cloudy light gold with an average white head. Aroma of fruit, malt, and spice. Taste is citrus, malt, caramel, and spice. Nice!

55 cl bottle @ Timo A.
Pours clear pale golden color with a small head. Aroma of mandarin, orange zest, some pale malts, herbal and spice notes and some caramel. Flavor of pale malts, sweetish orange, herbs, faint spices and some bun dough. Quite odd for this style but still very tasty.
3424

UPDATED: AUG 2, 2014 
55 cl bottle @ Timo A, BBE 03/2014
Aroma is a bit odd with apricot, hay and bun dough. Flavour is rather strong on apricot. Also yeasty bun dough notes and spices. Spicy notes get stronger towards the end of the glass. Odd stuff, not very typical to this style. Not sure which style this should be though. If this really is bottom fermented.

550 ml bottle, thanks olio. Pours a golden colour with a white head. Aroma of grainy malts, yeast, baking powder and citrus. Flavour of grainy malts, spices, citrus, grass, hay and straw. Baking powder and cinnamon in the flavour as well. Medium bodied, oily mouthfeel and a grainy sweetish finish. Interesting.

550 ml bottle bought at The Bottle Shop in Sai Kung.
Look: Translucent golden honey orange colour with flaky yeast sediments; Half finger head and white foam which lasts about 20 seconds; Small sticky lacing with small fizzy carbonation.

Aroma: Very fragrant and fruity, which can be smelt a feet away, inc. light fresh grapefruit, lemon, pineapple, jackfruit, light floral, light honey, and light malt.

Taste: Nice light sweet taste of mid to light malt, with strong dill, light grapefruit, light bread, citrus / lime and creeping grass.

Body: Medium body, quite thick and rich palate.

Mouth Feel: Slightly resembles Fullers English Strong Ales, with low key, light but tasty lager malt and some bready character. Like it already! Sorachi Ace also contributes expressive herbal dill, and some good low grapefruit in a soft carbonated, very relaxing feel. 

Hoppiness: Sorachi Ace works like a T - damn refreshing and fleshy grapefruit plus assorted tropical fruits for nose, nice herbal dill, low-key grapefruit and moderate citrus for taste, and a slowly creeping bitterness which becomes prominent with further sips and ends with nice grassy finish.

After Taste: Slightly dry, very easy and refreshing to mouth.

Comments: This one has all the feel of a typically good Fullers ESAs, but it has all the nice features as advertised: Kaneko Golden malt is uniquely low key and tasty, and the Sorachi Aces fruitiness nose and nice dill taste is clearly expressed here. If anyone thinks Strong Pale / IPL are just crappy Euro macros, have a taste of this and youll find there are indeed greener pastures out there. Highly recommended!

First of all let me say wow! From a 11.2 FL.OZ bottle. poured a hazy golden yellow and the med white head disapates fast.  I smell light citrus,  malt,  flowers,  and baked white bread.  I taste all of the same with some sweet caramel and light citrus.  Wonderful!
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; clear golden yellow pour with thin white head, lemon and malt aroma, taste is nutty with sweet malts a hint of caramel, some orange and bubblegum, sticky mouthfeel.
Bottle. Smells like apples. Golden, slightly hazy. Nice dry and lightly tart. I like this.
Delicious and smooth. Pour is cloudy with floaters. Nice white head on this brew. Taste is a bit lemony.

Grassy golden color with abundant bubbles. Spicy, earthen and grassy aroma and flavor. Tastes like a spunky, peppery pilsner. Not bad. The fact its a bit stronger explains why its automatically better.
Glowing orange body, lively white head, spotty lacing.  Citrus, fruity yeast, bready malts, some yeast spice.  Medium bodied, creamy carbonation, light bitterness, nice finish.
I find that I concur with all sentiments expressed by Mr. Ashton McCobb. That is all.

55cl bottle from Appellation Wines. Pours a bright orange golden with a nice fluffy head. Theres an orangey malt thing going on for the nose. The taste vanilla, lemon-citrus and the combination of the malt and hops is producing something akin to wood spice. The palate is medium bodied, slightly sweet but with a crisp finish that makes you want another drink. Overall, great beer!

Pours a hazy yellow with a finger of foam that settles out quickly. Lots of biscuit bready malts, touch of herbal tea and honey, grassy floral notes. Pretty nice but could use a little more carbonation to pick the flavors up a notch.

Draft.  Pours a clear golden color with a small white head.  The aroma is herbal, light citrus, grass, floral, with some pale malt.  The flavor is floral and herbal hops, grass, lightly toasted malt, a touch of caramel with a soapy note to the finish.  Decent enough, not my thing though.

On tap at the Common Table. Golden pour with a white head. The aroma and flavor are very pleasant. I get a nice touch of biscuit and light toffee, as well as some lemons and a bit of orange. Thin mouthfeel and medium carbonation.
Nice work. Slightly high gravity pilsner with a bit more viscosity than usually. Great brine and hop aroma with just a hint of pineapple in the finish. Right in between common and imperial pilsner.

Bottle; Pour is slightly murky golden with a two finger, fine bubbled creamy head in this glass; there is some light spotting present here, with average retention present. The nose is floral, spicy, caramel, and grain. The flavor profile is initial modest bitter, cream, floral, a modest spicing, more bready malts. The mouthfeel is somewhat thick, and it is sweet, like candied sugar. Its a decent drinker , different of course -
Bottle. The look is clear, golden in color, with an ok off white head. The smell is grass, floral, malt, cereal, sweet, and ok. The taste is sweet but plesant, lemon, grass, floral, and ok.
Clear golden color with a good sized white head. Aroma is of rice, grain, grass. Taste is of grain, light mango and lemongrass, crisp.

tap @ nobi, but at the prices its going for around town, i only went with a sample. lows in town- $7.50, highs-$9.50 for a snifter. fuck that noise! .. . geed gold .. great foam .. lots of grain, hay, and bamboo .. . mild yeast .. . refreshing 

. . . . whats good as new? whos talking!?!

Draft. Poured clear golden color with medium frothy white head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Medium balanced aroma. Medium body with a smooth texture and soft carbonation. Medium bittersweet flavor with a medium bittersweet finish of moderate duration. My expectations where met.

Pours a slightly hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma is yeasty, fruits with some herbal notes and I guess is what the Kaneko Golden barley. Taste is light sweet leading to a light bitterness in the finish. Interesting

On tap. Clear golden color. Thin white head that retains very well. Leaves little lace. Medium body. Nice smooth lighter carbonation. Little more of a chewy body compared to your typical pils. Finish is more on the dry side. Bready pilsner malts. Nice hop profile - more tropical fruit than grassy. Light bitterness, more sweet. Good imperial pils.

Appearance: Clear golden color with a white head.Aroma: Sweet fruity (apple) and malty.Palate: Medium body. Slightly sweet and a mild bitterness. Average carbonation.Taste: Fresh fruity and and malty.Overall impression: Fresh and tasty.Personal stats: Sample from a bottle at Beer13 in Oslo, Norway

Pours a lightly hazy golden with a nice tight white head.  

The aroma is doughy with some nice floral hop notes. The maltiness comes in a weird way in the aroma... a touch metallic but then bright and fruity as well...  

The flavor is just damned satisfying. Lots of fruitiness but not a lot of sweetness. A perfect level of satisfying hop bitterness, loads of herbal and floral hoppiness. Some nice doughy/yeasty character that works well alongside the very clean fermentation of the beer and the very nice crisp maltiness of the beer. Honestly Im practically floored by the flavor of this beer, it is essentially everything I find satisfying in the best pale lagers Ive had.... truly remarkable.  

The beer has a nice prickly mouthfeel and a long bitter finish.  

Hot damn if this didnt smell better itd make my top ten without a doubt.

From bottle at Beer13. Pours pretty clear golden with a lasting white head. Slightly fruity aroma with notes of yeast and hops. Reminds me somehow of fermented apples? Balanced and quite nice. Moderate sweet with fruity flavours. Interesting beer. (2013-04-19)

Pours a hazy straw yellow colour with a small but consistent white head. Aroma is spicy/grassy/citrus sorachi hops, and sweet malts. Flavour is grass, mild bitterness, citrus, and a lighter malty sweetness.

Pours a hazy pale straw color with a nice white head that lasts for a bit. Aroma of bready malts, lemon citrus and grass from the beautiful sorachi ace hop variety. Taste is a excellent blend of the scratching ace lemon grassy flavors and the bready malts. Love the nice light feel on the mouth and the overall flavor, great beer.

Bottle from Sams Quik Shop. Pours a bright pale golden with a white head and steady lacing. Nose of grassy hops, lemony citrus, bready malts. Taste shows additional hints of fresh ginger, lemongrass, and light sweetness. Great balance; super refreshing. Lord, if only this were not $5.49 for 12oz.

11.2 oz. bottle.  Pours a hazy antique gold with a moderate white head that lasted through the first two sips and left very little lace.  Pleasant aroma of malt with some sweet notes and just a hint of lemon.  The flavor is malt again with a bit of sweetness and just a bit of lemon.  Mild bitterness at the finish.  Medium bodied.  No problems.

Bottle. Pours light gold with a slight white head that leaves some sheeting. Light lemony, slightly spicy aroma. Taste is spectacular. Crisp, clean, slightly grassy, only a little sweet with a bit of lemongrass. Incredibly smooth drinking.

Hazy gold with a large white head. Aroma has gentle lemon, leafy herbs, light dough. Alive texture with moderate carbonation. Theres a cleanness to the palate that distinguishes it from the old one - or maybe thats just suggestion). Hoppy, but mainly that sets off the straightforward but lovely pale malt. Hints of pears, mandarins, delicate lemon, modest but punchy pepper - probably suggestion again, but comes across as shiso leaf. Dry and faintly woody with lingering spices.

Veiled golden pour topped by a creamy and sticky white head. It makes for an attractive appearance. On the nose, a herbal (sage, dill?), tea-like hop character with a zesty lemon connotation that is both forward and well integrated to the ensemble. Entering the mouth, a fairly simple, yet impressive malt impression hits the palate, akin to the best 100% pils malt lagers or pure Marris Otter English ales. That special Japan barley, whether Im swallowed by marketing or genuinely touched, impresses me with its delicate tannic qualities, pure barley flavours and soft cerealic chewiness. Hay-like and raw cookie dough impressions accompany this stunner nicely as this lager shows bready flavours that remind of high-fermented Belgian yeast strains. Good dosage between sugars and dryness permits a creamy, unagressive carbonation full of soft large bubbles. The hop are never stealing the show here, just adding the required refreshment in that mountain of barley. Thats a neat beer, never feeling as strong as 6.5% with very well extracted flavours that never try to reach extremes.

Bottle from Stirchley Wines, Birmingham, via the_bish. Probably the best use of Sorachi Ace yet sampled. Sweet, gentle coconut flavour, with some herbs also. Stylistically mysterious: its like a Belgian Ale, crossed with a strong UK ale, but comes out as an Imperial Pils. Light, easy drinking, but compelling taste. Pale yellow, with lacing. Thanks Bish.

Bottle shared at GBBF 2011
Dark amber with characteristic hay and bubblegum aroma of sorachi ace. Interesting chewy malt, lemongrass, biscuit and full mouthfeel.
Never had a beer like it. Herb... I guess lemongrass and maybe some coconut. Seriously delicious, wish I could get more and it was cheaper.

Draught at Izakaya, Dublin. Hazy golden pour with thin white head. Aroma full of lemongrass, lemon peel, fresh herbs,very light and sweet biscuity malt. Taste is full of the Sorachi Ace hop flavours - that zingy, herby lemon note is unmistakable; a tasty light biscuity malt profile really does let the hop do its work, and a Belgian-like yeast complexity comes through near the finish, ending with a satisfyingly bitter, but very dry, citrus bite. A lovely beer, haven't had many like it, and that 7% ABV does sneak up on you after a few for sure!

Draft at Isaac Newtons. Pours honey with very little head. A bit of citrus on the nose. Grapefruit and floral notes on the tongue. I get a bit of earthiness on the finish kind of a woodsy thing. this is a beer that kicks you right in the bollocks. Fantastic!

Bottle at home. Mid yellow / straw colour with a thin white head and a little lacing. The initial aromas are reminisent of a beligian yeast and slighlty floral similar to Triple Karmeliet. The first flavour is lemon citrus and lovely Sorachi ace character with cocunut in the finish. Highly carbonated and slightly thin on the palete.

One-third pint, 6.4% abv., from the draft menu of guest ales at BrewDog Glasgow. Nicely served with a golden body and thin layer in a BrewDog glass. Taste of dry fruity hops assisted by mild lemon. Fresh and smooth fruity flavour with mango and herbal hops. Rounded fruit bitterness to the ending. Subdued oily palate. Medium bodied. Unusual taste profile, not easy to describe. Likable, 10.04.2012.

Draft. WOW!

Nice fruit, bread, spice and floral notes. A solid full body that finishes sweet and bitter.

Gravity at JCBF 2012. Bright honey gold with no head or bubbles. Lemony Sorachi Ace nose with light malts. Sweet honey lemon flavor, buttery and rich malt and Sorachi. Smooth, flat, full body. Very nice.

Bottle. Hazy gold with a foamy white head. Aroma is spicy and rather herbal with fresh cut wood and light lemony notes. Taste brings more spice notes, herbal notes, lemony zest, woody notes and dusty yeast. Body is medium with a strong, bubbly, effervescent carbonation. Finishes with more fresh cut wood, peppery spice, fresh herbs, yeast notes, light lemon, and sweet maltiness.

On keg at the BrewDog bar in Edinburgh. Pours a golden colour with a thick white head. An orange citrus aroma with caramel and alcohol also. Similar flavours with moderate carbonation and an oily mouth-feel. Lingering tangerine. Tasty.

From bottle. Pours golden with some yeast floaters and a tight white head. Complex fruity aroma, something I havent had before, some lime, zesty, lager yeast comes across very nicely with the other notes, slightly herbal, medicinal, floral. Taste has citrus, zest, exotic fruit, lime, light caramel malt and the lager yeast ties it all together, there are lots of flavors I havent experienced before. Crisp and refreshing on the palate, perfectly balanced. I could drink 5 pints of this. Top marks for originality, a unique beer
Keg @ BrewDog Glasgow. Hazy amber yellow brown colour, not much head. Complex perfumey fruity aroma. Dry resin perfume flavour. Smooth with bitter sweet aftertaste. Unusual.

Aroma is fantastic and unusual with loads of fruit that has a white wine quality with a woody, earthy background, almost like an oaked chardonnay. The taste of the beer never really lives up to the aroma, with taste and body a little thin with a background of vaguely unpleasant sourness. An interesting beer nonetheless.
Keg at Brewdog Glasgow.  Light orange body, thin head. Fruity nose, oranges, peachy, satsumas. Excellent beer.

Keg at BrewDog Aberdeen. It pours slightly hazy light orange, with a thin white head. The nose is sweet orange, mango, tangerine and some herbal notes. The taste is full of fruit - orange, apricot, mango, tangerine, tinned fruit (pear, melon and apple), bubblegum and a touch of herb. Medium body, moderate carbonation and nice balance. Surprisingly good.

Clear touch hazy yellow amber like a saison. Nose is weird. Yuzu orange, strawberries, saison yeasty, pungent. Taste is yuzu orange, saison yeast and citrous. Unusual mix of flavours and a bit of an acquired taste, but it grows on the palate.

A slightly cloudy golden blonde body with a big white head that faded to a thin coating with mild retention.  Aroma had nice toasted malt notes and some mild sweetness to it.   Hops predominantly floral  with some delicate pepper notes.   Flavor was well balanced mild malt notes were subtly sweet and hop notes were floral like the aroma.  There was a nice almost barnyard note throughout the flavor, similar to a saison.  Finish was crisp.

An interesting style, bottom fermented lager that focuses on traditional native ingredients. The nose comes up with a little brettonemyces and damp beaver pelt that conjours visions of grassy native wildlands. This folows through with cherry bottle caps (candy), and sweet sweat in the background, hiding like an asp on snake wacking day. The palate is linear with the structure and really highlights the Sorachi Ace hops, with lemongrass, powdered sugar and coriander. The Nipponia finished a little short and flat which is a shame, though this may be more on the age of the product than a technical fault of the batch. MMMMM sushi beer

Location: 22 oz bottle from Colonial Wine and Spirits, 1/10/12


Aroma:The nose is fairly sweet, with notes of fruit, bread, yeast, and some floral and spice hints too 

Appearance: Pours a slightly cloudy golden color with a foamy white head and a kind of creamy lace to it

Flavor: The taste is rather nice, with a rich complexity to it, some nice sweetness, and a light bitter backing 

Palate: It has a really nice mouthfeel with a soft carbonation, a smooth, creamy body, and a long duration

Overall Impression: 
I was pretty impressed by this one.  It is a really really solid lager.  It is a big, flavorful beer with a nice complexity and a really good mouthfeel.  I really enjoyed drinking this one.

From notes: Pours a hazy straw color with a small, white head.  Aroma is a nice, bright, citrusy orange.  Medium-bodied, with a slight depth to it.  Pleasant, bright flavor, reminiscent of orange zest.  Very nice.
draft at Blue Monk, Buffalo. Golden pour, floral, pot pourri, mild bitterness. Decent lager , definately more flavorful than most. Nice fuller creamy mouthfeel. Decent

On tap at Blue Monk 
Aroma dill, pine with citrus with Sorachi hops? 
 Appearance  amber gold with medium white top. rings on glass. Proper look. 3+
Flavor and Palate : mineral feel , more of dill blended with citrus elements. Mild herbal feel. Golden malts. This would be quiet nice but I cant stand dill flavours in any beers I had so far. This one is not a exception.

Draft. Pours cloudy gold with a nice white head, excellent retention/lacing. Melon/citrus hops, ginger, honey, bread, grass. Taste is very fruity/grassy, lemon, bread, moderate bitterness. Palate is oily, creamy carbonation, moderately bitter finish. Excellent.
Draft.  Clear golden color, white edge head.  Aroma of slightly sour tropical fruits.  Taste of bitter paper, grapefruit, straw.  Interesting.

UPDATED: NOV 23, 2011 Draft at Churchkey.  Nose of ginger, honey, citrus, lemon, mint.  Flavor is citrusy, more ginger, fresh malt.  Tasty, very fresh and clean.  **I was a "little" bit hungover when I was drinking this at churchkey with craftycarl, gt, travlr and biggurlpanties but damn was it amazing.  Even though I wasnt really wasnt in the best shape to taste beer, this shit was on point like no other.  Much better than the ale.  So clean and succinct.

Tap at True Brew, Mito. Golden coloured with small white head. Aroma is Sorachi Ace stinky, dairy and chive. Lots of fruitiness, orange, bit of pineapple, more citrus. Taste is Sorachi Ace bubblegum sweetness, with slightly bitter finish. Nice and prickly in the mouth, medium carbonation. Nice and crisp. Very nice.

Tap.  Pours mostly clear gold with a medium, creamy white head, long retention with excellent lacing.  Aroma is fruity with lemon and citrus, biscuit malt, tropical and coconut notes.  Flavor is fruity with a malt backbone and a dry finish.  Medium-light body, low warmth, medium carbonation.
Candied orange peel and ginger nose. Sweet citrus and honey taste with a spicy end. Soft and oily texture with gentle carbonation.

tepid amber-gold, low small bubbled white ring head. Nose is insane: zesty orange, melon, pineapple, ultra bright and juicy with no muting sweetness, wood and pepper, high attenuation but bit of sweetness in soft pale grains. Flavor a bit letdown by comparison, not as bright as tipopills or husky as braumeister. Bit doughy, sorachi brightness accented by minor effervescent low-bubbled carbonation, quite oily actually. Flavor gains some grain and bitterness in finish, nice contrast with softly peppery here qualities, very complex and incredibly lasting. The flavor profile is a bit too convoluted, zwickel simplicity lost.

Pours a totally clear gold with a frothy white head.  Nose is very clear, floral, honey, light pine, light lemon.  Flavor is Hitachino all the way, a little rice-y, grainy, light lemon, a little grass.  Flavor is also very clean.  Medium bodied, grassy finish.

Draft.  Lightly hazed light amber body, small off-white head.  Aroma is medium sweet, bread, herbal, some wood.  Taste is medium sweet, herbal, some bread, light lemon, wood.  Medium body, light effervescence, some resin.

Tap at Churchkey. Rich golden color with relatively good head retention. I honestly dont remember the appearance that much because of the incredible aroma and taste that followed. I blacked out. The aroma is like the best spring bouquet of flowers. My notes say something along the lines of "if you give this to a girl she will  have your baby." Its just a delicious pinapple, coconut, floral explosion of awesome. Seriously. The taste does justice to the aroma. Very similar with that pinapple, floral, coconut in there, but with an added hoppy bitterness that ensures the beer is not too sweet. Excellent. Palate is a bit oily and again, that oily hoppy bitterness is what balances the beer. This is a gem.

Tap at Churchkey. The pour is a clear orange with a small, white head. Thin, white layer sticks around for a moment. Pretty unassuming pour. Nose....uhh what is this? Big mango explosion with pineapple, coconut, and mandarin orange. Very rich and meaty fruits like jackfruit and mango flesh. As it warms it moves to nectar, honey, floral bouquet that is really something to cherish. Taste is extremely oily and rich...has a silky near butterscotch palate where you are really looking for diacetyl but there is none to be found. Rather it is ultra quenching and perfect in the palate like coconut oil cut by mandarin orange acidity. Almost faux oily richness. Really a superlative palate. I have a ton of notes here just trying to spit off the things that come to mind: mint, Spring day, nectar oil. This is incredible.

Draft at ChurchKey. Cloudy gold pour. The nose is absolutely gorgeous; notes of nectar fruit including mango, pineapple, and melon abound, along with light herbal and grassy hops. The flavor holds more nectarine and sweet fruity esters, along with much more hops. Some biscuity malt lends balance to the overall structure, and the lager yeast provides a crisp and refreshing palate, though still with some really commendable body and oomph. Truly excellent.
Draft. Pours golden orange with a white head. Fruity and pale malty aroma, with spicy hops. The flavor has spicy and earthy hops, with some light fruity sweetness and grains. Really good.

Draft at Redlight Redlight. No more than a couple weeks in the States, at most.  The pour yields a beautiful milky-golden body strewn with effervescing, champagne-like bubbles.  An off-white eggshell head sits squat at the surface, dense, smooth, and foamy.  Slowly subsiding to a thin film, the head leaves a thick ring of micro-mesh lace all over the glass.  The nose is gorgeous, showing a very lightly toasted, ultra-clean bread malt base, peppered with bright floral hops, clean grasses, and slightly twangy lager yeast.  A kiss of blonde honey provides some additional sweetness. Flavors follow suit, coming across fresh, clean, hoppy, and bready.  Light grain meets softly sweet bread dough, crisp grass, and mild citrus. Yeast plays a huge role, as it does in all top lagers. In this instance, it is creamy and doughy, zippy and peppery. The palate is substantive, layered with ample sugars, yet it is delicately aerated with lively bubbles, making it entirely quaffable. Damn fine stuff here. Miles better than the ale yeast version.  Excellent beer.

draft @ redlight redlight.  Tropical fruit on the nose, pineapple & papaya.  Pours a slightly hazy gold with a solid white head.  Tropical fruit notes upfront, pineapple and mango with a hint of citrus with a dry earthy bitter finish.  Very nice drinking lager.

Draft at gingerman with Linh, Ken, nica. Pours a hazy golden body with great white carbonated lacing. Aroma is floral, herbal, light fruits, and floral hops. Mouthfeel is carbonated and creamy with great grainy notes, floral hops and a light sweetness. A great beer.

On tap at Ginger Man.  Pours a lightly hazed gold with a medium sized white head.  A touch of sake yeast on the nose, soft musk and sweetness.  Softly floral, with a light cedar note as it warms. Gently sweet hops.  Toasty and smooth.  Medium bodied, gentle hops, sweet and delicious.  Medium bodied, earthy and sweet, a nice amount of wood and toast.  Spicy cedar notes linger long afterward.  Fruity and estery and lovely.  Very nice, and certainly gains some nice complexity as it warms up.  If you can let it last that long.
Draft at gingerman. Golden pour with white head. Floral, fruit, herb, sage and spices in aroma. Light Apple, spice, and solidly light flavored brew.

On tap at The Ginger Man.  Very interesting and hard to categorize.  RB calls it a keller, but to me it seemed closer to an IPA.  Sweet and well balanced, with flavors of rice and other grains.  It is a bit astringent with some herbal and floral touches - I cant tell exactly what is in here, but it all adds up to a tasty and complex beer.  I dont know what the name refers to, since my hunch is that it is influenced primarily by American microbrews.

Phone rate. Draught at The Ginger Man NYC, $10 a 10or 12oz pour.clear amber with a one finger creamy off-white head, down to a thick film the duration. Aroma of some fruity pear (thank you Ryan) husky grain and faint honey, with a little lemon curd grassy citrus. Flavor is of some spicy grassy hops, scantily toasted grain following. Dry finish, bitterness peaking around at a solid 3. Pillowy soft body, light carbonation. I wouldnt hesitate to call this an elegant beer, subtle and complex all the same.  Pretty good beer for sure, but I wont BJ this beer to the top 50 like the last three nerds. ;-) just kidding, gentleman.  4.9!!!
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: Holy fucking grail of lagers big up to Andy pants for the tip off.  Holy fuck this is slamming.  Beautiful transparant copper body with a light off white lace quickly diminishing.  Aromatically a soft pear and floral tone.  Hints of agave and fresh laundry sheet like freshness.  A total pleassure to sip on.  Very soft blanket of carbonation.  Light apple crisps, pear tones very light hay and fruit puch notes quicky give way to a juicy soft spicy hop tone.  Nice tongue tigling spice with a touch of lavender grass and spice.  Astonushing in its freshness n glory.  I think im in love.

Tap at Gingerman - YEs! this is what a lagers should be like. Week old keg obviously helps. Crystal clear malts, with a tiny grainy edge, balanced well by amazingly lemony sorachi ace hops. Plenty of floral and herbal character. Strikes the perfect balance between sweet, dry and bitter elements. Smooth bodied/ drinks like a dream. Too bad it was $10/12oz...
One week old keg at the Ginger Man. Unfiltered. Fantastic spicy hop aroma, razor-sharp aged Italian cheese and garden fresh herbs. The flavor is just lovely, so fresh and quaffable. Incredible.
